Method.name: createFromFrontendCSPSession
Method.Implementation:
set contextData = ..%New() set contextData.eventID=$G(%session.Data("eventsforce","frontend","xEventID"))
Do contextData.setControllerID()
set contextData.languageID=$G(%session.Data("eventsforce","frontend","xPrefLangID")) if contextData.languageID="" { set contextData.languageID=$G(%session.Data("eventsforce","frontend","xLangID")) } do contextData.setAuditPersonIDfromFrontend()
set contextData.sessionID=%session.SessionId return contextData

Method.name: createFromFrontendCSPSession
Method.Implementation:
#dim sessionID as %String = %session.SessionId
set contextData = ##super()
set contextData.tempPersonID=$G(%session.Data("eventsforce","frontend","currentPersonID")) set contextData.loggedInPersonID=$G(%session.Data("eventsforce","xtfrontend","MyAccount","personID")) set contextData.backendPersonID=$G(%session.Data("eventsforce","backend","xPersonID")) set contextData.attendeeCategoryID=##class(eCom.tempPurchase).getEventCategory(sessionID,contextData.tempPersonID) if contextData.attendeeCategoryID="" { if contextData.loggedInPersonID { // this will be used to restrict the categories of sessions in the daily agenda before registration set contextData.attendeeCategoryID=##class(links.lnkPersonEventCategory).getPreSelectedAttendeeCategoryID(contextData.eventID,contextData.loggedInPersonID) } else { set contextData.attendeeCategoryID = ##class(setup.lnkCategoryEvent).getDefault(contextData.eventID) } } set contextData.currencyID=+##class(eCom.tempPurchase).getCurrencyID(sessionID) set contextData.isAmendment=+$G(%session.Data("eventsforce","frontend","amend")) set contextData.tempPurchaseID=##class(eCom.tempPerson).getTempPurchaseID(contextData.tempPersonID) set contextData.isBackendBooking=##class(eCom.tempPurchase).isBackendBooking(sessionID) set contextData.pricingHorologUTC=##class(eCom.tempPurchase).getPriceHorologUTC(contextData.tempPurchaseID) set contextData.prowebMode=%session.Get("mode") set contextData.pageID=%session.Get("pageID") set contextData.prowebComponentName = "Main List" do contextData.setAuditPersonIDfromFrontend()
set contextData.isBackendSuperUser=##class(eCom.tempPurchase).isBackendSuperUser(sessionID)
return contextData

return contextData

Method.name: createNew
Method.Implementation:
#dim mockTempPersonID as %Integer = 100 #dim mockBackendUserD as %Integer = 1 #dim mockEventID as %Integer = 15235 #dim mockPageID as %Integer = 122589
set contextData = ..%New()
set contextData.componentName = "Main List" set contextData.eventID = mockEventID set contextData.pageID = mockPageID set contextData.languageID=1 set contextData.tempPersonID = mockTempPersonID set contextData.loggedInPersonID = mockBackendUserD set contextData.attendeeCategoryID=1 set contextData.currencyID=1 set contextData.isAmendment=0 set contextData.tempPurchaseID=1 set contextData.isBackendBooking=0 set contextData.pricingHorologUTC=##class(shared.timeFunctions).getCurrentHorologUTC() set contextData.prowebMode="preview" set contextData.sessionID="mockSession"
return contextData

Method.Implementation: set rs=##class(%ResultSet).%New("%Library.DynamicQuery:SQL") Set tableName=##class(EF.utils.classes).getFullTableRefFromFullClassName(..%ClassName(1)) set query="SELECT ID FROM "_##class(EF.encoders.sql).encodeTableName(tableName)_" WHERE (sessionID = ?)" do rs.Prepare(query) do rs.Execute(..sessionID) while rs.Next() { set pageController=##class(EF.pageController.page).%OpenId(rs.Get("ID")) do pageController.delete() }

Method.Implementation: #dim elementIdentifier as %String = "proweb-1" #dim labelText as %String = "First Name" #dim value as %String = "Elvis" #dim element as EF.pageController.element #dim page as EF.pageController.proweb.page set contextData = ##class(EF.contextDataRegistrationMock).createMock() set page= ##class(EF.pageController.proweb.page).createNew(contextData) set element = page.addProwebTextInput(elementIdentifier, labelText, value) do page.uiComponent.childComponents.SetAt(element.uiComponent,1) set element.uiComponent.contextData = contextData set returnedHTML = ##class(EF.utils.outputRedirection).redirectMethodOutputToString(page,"render") set returnedHTML = $ZStrip(returnedHTML,"*WC") set expectedHTML = "FirstName" do $$$AssertEquals(returnedHTML,expectedHTML)

<csp:class encoded="1" private="1">

<script language="cache" method="OnPreHTTPafter" arguments="" returntype="%Library.Boolean"> 
	/// saves the submitted data from the request into the temp structure
	/// this page can be called by all pages using the pageClass structure for temp storage, no configuration required
	set contextData = ##class(EF.contextDataRegistration).createFromFrontendCSPSession()
	set pageControllerID=%request.Get("pageControllerID")
	
	set ok=1
	try {
		set pageController=##class(EF.pageController.page).open(pageControllerID,contextData)
	} catch {
		w 1/0 set ok=0 // ###########
	}
	
	set backforward=##class(setup.objPageNav).goWhere("codFormSave.csp", , contextData.tempPersonID, %request.Get("pageID"))
	set redirectURL = $Piece(backforward,"|",2)
	set %response.Redirect=redirectURL

	set pageController.submitButtonClickedIdentifier=%request.Get("efSubmitButtonIdentifier")
	
	if %request.Get("efSaveAndReloadFormOnly") {
		// copy submitted fields into the pageController
		do pageController.updateFromRequest()
		do pageController.%Save()

	} else {
		// copy submitted fields into the pageController
		do pageController.updateFromRequest()
		
		// validate all data
		do pageController.validatePage()
		
		// save the temp structure to database
		if 'pageController.hasError {
			// save temp structure to database
			Try {
				// the save has the validation and THROWS exceptions if any validations fail
				do pageController.save()

			} Catch exObj {
				set ok=0
				If exObj.%IsA("shared.exceptions.generalException") {
					set error=exObj.DisplayString()
				} else {
					// don't know what this error was (like a sub method throwing an error)
					set error="There was an error saving this page"
					throw exObj
				}
				do pageController.setErrorMessage(error)
				
			}
			
		}
		
		do pageController.%Save()
	}
	do pageController.copyAllDataToEComTemp()
	quit 0
</script>
#(backforward)#

// please note that the NEW command dannot be used in rules! (nor the: ) // This little beuty replaces the given path in compile time with a call to an inherited page method in runtime! // It also translates the 'Alt' and the 'Title' attributes //Same as above but for input tags with images (submit button to you and me) // language thing for href tags with titles // language thing for span tags with titles // Replace the path to the stylesheet // No longer needed, but you can't just delete a csp rule // Translate the breadtext // create if statements around a section of code based on the systemType (setup.objSystemType) The autoelse=1 causes an ELSE to be written automatically containing the "This is only available in the following editions..." message If autoelse is used then you CANNOT use ELSE. do email stuff see description for systemTypeIF // ============================================================================================================================= // please note that the NEW command cannot be used in rules! (nor the: ) // ============================================================================================================================= The CS:TEXT tag is the proWeb's initialising a template page. // ============================================================================================================================= The CS:TEXT tag is the proWeb's ending a template page. // ============================================================================================================================= The CS:TEXT tag is the proWeb's way of outputting a block of text. It will include an external page that only handles texts. Texts may include html formatting. // ============================================================================================================================= FRRE RULE The SC:FREE tag is the proWeb's way of outputting a list of freely chosed items. It will include an external page that only handles lists. // ============================================================================================================================= The CS:IMAGE tag is the proWeb's way of outputting an image. It will include an external page that only handles images.

<!-- The floating menu loader --> 
<script language="cache" runat="server">
	new app
	set app=##class(sc.objData).applicationPath()
	// clear the flag that's used when selected re-use item. So wthat we don't get the icon in any subsequent page
	kill %session.Data("selectItem")

	set hideDependent=##class(setup.objEventSetting).getParameter("reg pages","hide dependent questions",xEventID)
	if $G(isForm) {
		&SQL(SELECT parent INTO :tmp FROM sc.objData WHERE ID = :pageID)
		if +SQLCODE=0 {
			&SQL(SELECT hideDependentPrompts INTO :tmp2 FROM sc_xModules.objForm WHERE ID = :tmp)
			if +SQLCODE=0 {
				if tmp2 {
					set hideDependent="hide"
				} else {
					set hideDependent="grey"
				}
			}
		}
	}
	if hideDependent="" set hideDependent="grey"
</script>
<csp:if condition=(%session.Get("mode")="edit")>	
	<script language="cache" runat="server">
	// jump to the last used item
	set anchorID=%session.Get("dataID")
	kill %session.Data("dataID")
	if (anchorID'="") {
		write !,"<scr"_"ipt language='javasc"_"ript'>"
		write !,"location.hash='#anchor_"_anchorID_"';"
		write !,"</scr"_"ipt>"
	}
  	//initial warning for users entering reg prompt drag & drop mode for the first time
  	set userID=%session.Data("eventsforce","backend","xPersonID")
  	   		
  	set hasSeenDnDWarning=0
  	if (##class(cod.objItemData).get(userID,"hasSeenDnDWarning")=1) {
		set hasSeenDnDWarning=1		
  	} else {
		do ##class(sc.xModules.objCODitem).add(ok,"hasSeenDnDWarning",0,userID,"system",0,"","text",0,"",0,0,0,0,0,1,0,"")
		
	  	// update the data for this user
	  	do ##class(cod.objItemData).set(userID,"hasSeenDnDWarning",1)
  	 }
	</script>
	<!-- Output the javascript functions-->
	 <script type="text/javascript">
 	window.onload=function () {
	 	// if we've just come from editing in moxie we need to refresh all images
	 	// they may have been resized in that editing session but the browser will most likely cache the version viewed in this page just a moment ago
	 	// do this by adding a random string to the image src
	 	var myImageElems = document.getElementsByTagName('img');
	 	var max = myImageElems.length;
	 	var now = new Date();
	 	for (var i=0;i<max;i++) {
		 	var myImg=myImageElems[i];
		 	if  (myImg.src.indexOf('uploaded')>-1){
		 		if (myImg.src.indexOf('?')>-1){
			 		myImg.src = myImg.src + '&' + now.getTime();	
		 		}else{
			 		myImg.src = myImg.src + '?' + now.getTime();	
		 		}
	 		}
	 	}
	 	
	 	if ('#(hasSeenDnDWarning)#' == '0'){
	 		alert ("#(..translateAdmin("Please be aware that registration prompts are now positioned by dragging them with the mouse. Release the mouse button when the prompt is in the desired position."))#");	
	 	}
 	}
 </script>
	<script language="javascript">
	
	function confirmDelete(dataID) {
		if (confirm("Are you sure that you want to delete this item?\nPlease note that this action is not possible to undo.") == true) {
			document.location = '#(..Link(app_"/backend/proweb/deleteListItem.csp?zz=1"))#&dataID=' + dataID;
		}
	}
	
	// The floating menu loader 
	
	   HM_DOM = (document.getElementById) ? true : false;
	   HM_NS4 = (document.layers) ? true : false;
	    HM_IE = (document.all) ? true : false;
	   HM_IE4 = HM_IE && !HM_DOM;
	   HM_Mac = (navigator.appVersion.indexOf("Mac") != -1);
	  HM_IE4M = HM_IE4 && HM_Mac;
	
	 HM_Opera = (navigator.userAgent.indexOf("Opera")!=-1);
	 HM_Konqueror = (navigator.userAgent.indexOf("Konqueror")!=-1);
	
	HM_IsMenu = !HM_Opera && !HM_IE4M && (HM_DOM || HM_NS4 || HM_IE4 || HM_Konqueror);
	
	HM_BrowserString = HM_NS4 ? "NS4" : HM_DOM ? "DOM" : "IE4";
	
	if(window.event + "" == "undefined") event = null;
	function HM_f_PopUp(){return false};
	function HM_f_PopDown(){return false};
	popUp = HM_f_PopUp;
	popDown = HM_f_PopDown;
	
	
	//HM_GL_MenuWidth          = 1000;

	HM_GL_FontSize           = 10;

	function HM_f_CenterMenu(topmenuid) {
	    var MinimumPixelLeft = 0;
	    var TheMenu = HM_DOM ? document.getElementById(topmenuid) : window[topmenuid];
	    var TheMenuWidth = HM_DOM ? parseInt(TheMenu.style.width) : HM_IE4 ? TheMenu.style.pixelWidth : TheMenu.clip.width;
	
	    var TheWindowWidth = HM_IE ? (HM_DOM ? HM_Canvas.clientWidth : document.body.clientWidth) : window.innerWidth;
	
	    return Math.max(parseInt((TheWindowWidth-TheMenuWidth) / 2),MinimumPixelLeft);
	}
	if(HM_IsMenu) {
	    document.write("<SCR" + "IPT LANGUAGE='JavaScript1.2' SRC='#(app)#/system/proweb/HM_Script"+ HM_BrowserString +".js' TYPE='text/javascript' ><\/SCR" + "IPT>");
	}
	
	function  validateAndSubmit() {
			document.prowebSurveyForm.submit();

</script>
  <csp:if condition=($G(isCOD)!($G(isAward))!($G(isHotel))!($G(isForm)))>
  		<script language='javascript'> 
  			//warn against using the same prompt twice on the page
			var itemCount = document.prowebCODForm.length;
			var qf=0;
			for (i =0; i<itemCount;i++) {
				var itemName1=document.prowebCODForm.elements[i].name;
					
				if (itemName1 != '')	{  // JAW 28NOV2006 new calendar has some generated selects that use ID not name so name is blank
					for (j =0; j<itemCount;j++) {
						var itemName2=document.prowebCODForm.elements[j].name;
						if ((itemName1 == itemName2) && (i != j) && (document.prowebCODForm.elements[i].value == document.prowebCODForm.elements[j].value)) {
							if (itemName1 != 'tempPersonID') {
								var itemAlt=document.prowebCODForm.elements[j].alt;

								i=itemCount;
								j=itemCount;

<script language="cache" runat="server">
	// reload the page when contents has been auto-added
	if $G(%xPageModifiedAndNeedsReload)=1 {
		write !,"<script language='javascript'>location.reload(true);</scr"_"ipt>"
	}

	// in-site editing - output the form validation when editing in-site mode
	set show=0
	if $G(%session.Data("inSitePageEditing")) set show=1
	if %session.Get("mode")="preview" set show=1
</script>
<csp:if condition="show">
	<csp:if condition=($G(isCOD)!($G(isAward))!($G(isHotel))!($G(isForm))!($G(isMeetingInfoPage))!($G(isAbstract)))>
		<script language='javascript'> 
			function  validateAndSubmit() {
				if (validateMandatory() == true) {
					document.prowebCODForm.submit();
				} 
			}
		
			// check mandatory questions & checkboxes - v 2.6
			// *new* *improved* validateMandatory - now does max length of text fields client-side!!!!!
			function validateMandatory() { // also does radiobuttons
					
				var probs =0;
				// loop through fields looking for onkeyup & onblur events (== max length checking functions)
				// onblur events also include sentence casing & title casing, but these are idempotent so no problem to call these repeatedly
				// execute them and check global variable set within those functions for results
				
				// WILL NOT WORK ON SAFARI
				// see http://blog.swivel.com/code/2009/09/faking-keyboard-events-in-safari-a-work-in-progress.html for details
				
				
		
				var elems=document.prowebCODForm.elements;
				for (i=0;i<elems.length;i++){
					if(typeof elems[i].onkeyup === 'function'){
						// trigger the key up event - bound to char count function
						// cannot get return value from a triggered event handler
						// hence check global JS var which is updated from the ev handler function
						
						// IE
						if(elems[i].fireEvent){
							var newEvt = document.createEventObject()
							elems[i].fireEvent('onkeyup',newEvt);
						}
							
						// Gecko based browsers
						if(document.createEvent){
							var evt = document.createEvent("KeyboardEvent");
							if (typeof(evt.initKeyboardEvent) != 'undefined') { // Chrome
  								evt.initKeyboardEvent ('keyup', false, true, null, false, false, false, false, 0, 0) 
							} else { // all other Gecko
  								evt.initKeyEvent ('keyup', false, true, null, false, false, false, false, 0, 0) 
							}

							if(elems[i].dispatchEvent){
								elems[i].dispatchEvent(evt);
							}
						} 
					}

					if(typeof elems[i].onblur === 'function'){
						// trigger the blur event - bound to word count function
						// cannot get return value from a triggered event handler
						// hence check global JS var which is updated from the ev handler function
							
						elems[i].focus();
						
						// IE
						if(elems[i].fireEvent){
							elems[i].fireEvent('onblur');
						}
							
						// Gecko based browsers
						if(document.createEvent){
							var evt = document.createEvent("HTMLEvents");
							if (evt.initEvent) {
  								evt.initEvent( 'onblur', false, true );
							} 

							if(elems[i].dispatchEvent){
								elems[i].dispatchEvent(evt);
							}
						} 
					}
				}
				
				var checkitems=mandatories.split('|');
				var guestNo2 = '';
				var element = '';
				var tmp3 = '';
				var tmp4 = '';
				var guestNo = '';
				var guestOrDelegate='';
				var lastInvalid = '';
				var alertData=#(..QuoteJS(..out("The following fields are mandatory:")))#;  // used to store ALL the prompts that require input and list in ONE alert box rather than having to click OK 20 times
				var itemCount = checkitems.length-1;
				var isMulti = false;
				for (var i=0 ; i < itemCount ; i++ ) {
					tmp=checkitems[i].split('->');
					element=tmp[0];
					if (element.substring(0,3) == 'mul'){
						isMulti = true;
					} else {
						isMulti = false;
					}
					tmp4 = element.split('_');
					guestOrDelegate = tmp4[2];
					guestNo = tmp4[3];
					if (typeof guestNo == 'undefined') {
						guestNo='01';
					} else {
						guestNo = guestNo.substr(0,2);
					}
					descr=tmp[1];
					var ok = true;
					var fieldType= 'other';
					var exe ="if (document.prowebCODForm." + element + ".type == 'checkbox') fieldType = 'checkbox'; ";
					if (isMulti) {
						exe = null;
						fieldType = 'checkbox';
						continue; // pjc 2011-12-06 removing client-side validation of multiple checkboxes till post-4.5 release - need to check for min & max choices, not just if any are checked
					}
					eval(exe);
					if (fieldType == 'checkbox') {
						// pjc 2011-05-17 DEVPJCUI052011 add client-side validation of multiple checkboxes
						if (isMulti) {
							var prefix = element;
							var eleCount = document.prowebCODForm.elements.length;
							var multiChecked = false;
							for (var ii = 0; ii < eleCount; ii++) {
								if (document.prowebCODForm.elements[ii].name.indexOf(prefix) != -1){
									if (document.prowebCODForm.elements[ii].checked == true) {
										multiChecked = true;
										break;
									}
								}	
							}
							if (multiChecked == false){
								ok = false;
							}
							var exe = null;
						} else { // normal checkboxes
							var exe = "if (document.prowebCODForm." + element + ".checked == false)  {	ok = false; }";
						}
					} else if (element.substring(0,10) == 'fileUpload') {
							var exe = "if (document.prowebCODForm." + element + ".value != 'uploaded')  {	ok = false; }";
					} else { 
						if (element.substring(0,3) == 'rad') {
							var exe = "var tmp=0; var radioCount = document.prowebCODForm." + element + ".length; if (typeof radioCount == 'undefined' ) {	if (document.prowebCODForm." + element + ".checked == true) {	tmp = 1; } } else { for (ii =0; ii<radioCount;ii++) { if (document.prowebCODForm." + element + "[ii].checked == true) { tmp = 1; } }	} if (tmp==0) ok = false;";
						} else {
							var exe = "if (document.prowebCODForm." + element + ".value == '')  {	ok = false; }";
						}
					}
					eval(exe);
					
					// supress disabled fields
					if (supressDisabled(element) == true) ok= true;
					if ($("#" + element).hasClass("ef-ignore-mandatory")) {
						ok = true;
					}
					
					if ((ok ==false) && ( guestOrDelegate != 'guest')) {
						// delegates validation
						probs = 1;
						alertData=alertData + "\n" + descr
						lastInvalid = element;
					
					} else {					
						// suppress warning if none of the guest fields are populated
						// e.g. txtQuestion_3_guest_0201 but the first group lacks the last numbers (guestNo concatinated with displayOrder)
						if (ok == false) {
							// sole mandatory guest prompt fails allOthersEmpty check so add guestCount variable
							var guestCount = 0;
							var allOthersEmpty = true;	
							for (var i2=0 ; i2 < itemCount ; i2++ ) {
								tmp2=checkitems[i2].split('->');
								element2=tmp2[0];
																			
								if ((element2 != element)&&(element.substring(0,3) != 'rad')&&(element2.substring(0,3) != 'rad')&&(!(isMulti))) {
									
									tmp3 = element2.split('_');
									
									if (tmp3[2] == 'guest') {
										guestNo2 = tmp3[3];
										
										if (typeof guestNo2 == 'undefined') {
											guestNo2 = '01';	
										} else {
											
											guestNo2 = guestNo2.substr(0,2);
										}
										if (guestNo2 == guestNo) {
											guestCount++;
											exe = "if (document.prowebCODForm." + element2 + ".value != '')  {	allOthersEmpty = false; 	}";
											eval(exe);
											
										}	
									}
								} 		
							}
							//PBUG00004555 : SHAHADAT: We had to change this following condition back to how it was before v37 as otherwise, the old style guest funciton does not work.
							//Please note  Peter altered this bit of code before on my request to address the problem in parature ticket 4268.
							if ( allOthersEmpty == false || guestCount == 0) {
								alertData=alertData + "\n" + descr + " (guest field)";
								 lastInvalid= element;
								probs = 1;	
							} else {
								
							}
						}
					}	
					// add CSS class to elements if it makes sense to do so
					var myElem = document["prowebCODForm"].elements[element];
					if (myElem) {
						if (!(ok)) {
							if ((myElem.type != "radio") && (myElem.type != "checkbox")) {
								addClass(myElem, "mandatoryIgnored");
								tdElem=$(myElem).closest(".ef_proweb_form_field_container");
								if (tdElem.hasClass("ef_proweb_form_field_container_type_dropdown")) {
									tdElem.find(".select2-container").addClass("mandatoryIgnored");
								} else if (tdElem.hasClass("ef_proweb_form_field_container_type_dateRange")) {
									tdElem.find(".EF_inputBox").addClass("mandatoryIgnored");
								}
							}
						} else {
							removeClass(myElem,"mandatoryIgnored");
							tdElem=$(myElem).closest(".ef_proweb_form_field_container");
							if (tdElem.hasClass("ef_proweb_form_field_container_type_dropdown")) {
								tdElem.find(".select2-container").removeClass("mandatoryIgnored");
							} else if (tdElem.hasClass("ef_proweb_form_field_container_type_dateRange")) {
								tdElem.find(".EF_inputBox").removeClass("mandatoryIgnored");
							}
						}
					}
				} // end loop
				
				// make sure the two password fields match. Fred v 2.5
				if (passwordFields != '') {
					tmp = passwordFields.split("|");
					var pswField1 = tmp[0];
					var pswField2 = tmp[1];
					if ((pswField1 !='') && (pswField2 !='')) {
						exe = "var psw1 = document.prowebCODForm." + pswField1 + ".value";	
						eval(exe);
						exe = "var psw2 = document.prowebCODForm." + pswField2 + ".value";	
						eval(exe);
						
						if (psw1 != psw2) {
							probs = 1 ;
							lastInvalid = pswField1;
							alertData  =  '#(..out("Re-typed password does not match the first password"))#';
						}
					}
				}
				

				if (probs == 0) {
					return true;
				} else {
					alert(alertData);
					if (lastInvalid.substring(0,3) != 'rad') {
						exe = "document.prowebCODForm." + lastInvalid + ".focus();"
					}
					if (element.substring(0,3) == 'mul'){
						exe = null;
					}
					eval(exe);
					if ((document.prowebCODForm)&&(document.prowebCODForm.butProceed)) {
						document.prowebCODForm.butProceed.disabled = false;
					}
					return false;
				}
			}
			function updatePostCodeMandatoryFromCountry(countryElem,postCodeElem,postCodeMandatoryMarkerElem) {
				if ($('option:selected', countryElem).data("efCanIgnorePostCodeMandatory")) {
					disableMandatory(postCodeElem,postCodeMandatoryMarkerElem);
				} else {
					enableMandatory(postCodeElem,postCodeMandatoryMarkerElem);
				}	
			}
			
			function enableMandatory(inputElem,mandatoryMarkerElem) {
				$(inputElem).removeClass("ef-ignore-mandatory");
				$(mandatoryMarkerElem).show();
			}
			
			function disableMandatory(inputElem,mandatoryMarkerElem) {
				$(inputElem).addClass("ef-ignore-mandatory");
				$(mandatoryMarkerElem).hide();
			}
		</script>
		
		<script language="javascript">
			// output the function for disabling COD questions if dependent
			function toggleObjectDisable(objectName,value) {
				var tmp = objectName.split("Question");
				
				if ((tmp[0] == 'rad') ) {
					if (value == true) {
						$("input[name='"+objectName+"']").attr('disabled',true);
					} else {
						$("input[name='"+objectName+"']").attr('disabled',false);
					}
				} else if ((tmp[0] == 'mul') ) {
					var allEle=document.prowebCODForm.elements;
					for ( var i = 0;i < allEle.length; i++ ) {
						if (allEle[i].name.indexOf(objectName) == 0 ) {
							if (value == true) {
								allEle[i].disabled = true;
							} else {
								allEle[i].disabled = false;
							}
						} 
					}
				} else if (objectName.substring(0,10) == 'fileUpload'){
					if (value == true) {
						var str = "document.prowebCODForm." + objectName + ".disabled = true;"
						eval(str);
					} else {
						var str = "document.prowebCODForm." + objectName + ".disabled = false;"
						eval(str);
					}
				} else if (objectName.substring(0,4) == 'div_') {
					/* pjc 2009-11-03 dependencies added for text blocks */
					if (value == true) {
						// pjc 2010-05-04 only change colour if event is set to grey out dependent prompts - improve compatibility with events with customised CSS
						if ('#(hideDependent)#'=='grey') {
							var str = "if (document.getElementById('"+objectName+"')) { document.getElementById('"+objectName+"').style.backgroundColor = '#DDDDDD'; }"
							eval(str);
						}
					} else {
						// pjc 2010-05-04 only change colour if event is set to grey out dependent prompts - improve compatibility with events with customised CSS
						if ('#(hideDependent)#'=='grey') {
							// pjc 2010-01-19 bg-color used to be set to white; changed to transparent for compatibility with templates with non-white backgrounds
							var str = "if (document.getElementById('"+objectName+"')) { document.getElementById('"+objectName+"').style.backgroundColor = 'transparent'; }"
							eval(str);
						}
					}
					
					// hide the fields using style.display='none'
					if (objectName.substring(0,4) != 'div_') { // not a dependent text block
						objectName = 'div_' + objectName;
					}
					if (document.getElementById(objectName) != null) {
						if (value == true) {
							getStyleById(objectName).display='none';
						} else {
							// change display='block' to display=''
							// this accomodates dependent reg prompts placed on the same line - these are in a TR with the display attribute set at that level
							// TR with display='block' renders incorrectly in Chrome + FF
							getStyleById(objectName).display='';
						}
						/* remove spacing on hidden dep prompts + text blocks by specifying display: none on parent TR */
						var found = false;
						var pElem = document.getElementById(objectName);
						while ((!found) && (typeof pElem == "object")) {
							try {
								pElem = pElem.parentNode;
								if (pElem.nodeName.toLowerCase()=="tr") {
									found = true;
									if (value == true) {
										if (!(hasClass(pElem,"hiddenDep"))) {
											addClass (pElem,"hiddenDep");
										}
									} else {
										if (hasClass(pElem,"hiddenDep")) {
											removeClass (pElem,"hiddenDep");
										}
									}
								}										
							} catch (ex) {
								// found = true; // not actually found but avoid infinite loop in case of error
							}
						}
					}
					
					return; // finished with dependent text blocks
				} else {
					if (value == true) {
						// only change colour if event is set to grey out dependent prompts - improve compatibility with events with customised CSS
						if ('#(hideDependent)#'=='grey') {
							var str = "document.prowebCODForm." + objectName + ".style.backgroundColor = '#DDDDDD';"
							eval(str);
							$('#'+objectName).addClass('ef_element_dependent_disabled_but_visible');
						}
						if ($('#'+objectName).hasClass('k-input')) {
							if ($('#'+objectName).hasClass('efTimePicker')) {
								$('#'+objectName).data('kendoTimePicker').enable(false);
							}
							if ($('#'+objectName).hasClass('efDatePicker')) {
								$('#'+objectName).data('kendoDatePicker').enable(false);
							}
						}
						var str = "document.prowebCODForm." + objectName + ".disabled = true;"
						eval(str);
						
					} else {
						if ($('#'+objectName).hasClass('k-input')) {
							if ($('#'+objectName).hasClass('efTimePicker')) {
								$('#'+objectName).data('kendoTimePicker').enable(true);
							}
							if ($('#'+objectName).hasClass('efDatePicker')) {
								$('#'+objectName).data('kendoDatePicker').enable(true);
							}
						}
						var str = "document.prowebCODForm." + objectName + ".disabled = false;"
						eval(str);
						
						// only change colour if event is set to grey out dependent prompts - improve compatibility with events with customised CSS
						if ('#(hideDependent)#'=='grey') {
							// bg-color used to be set to white; changed to transparent for compatibility with templates with non-white backgrounds
							var str = "document.prowebCODForm." + objectName + ".style.backgroundColor = 'transparent';"
							eval(str);
							$('#'+objectName).removeClass('ef_element_dependent_disabled_but_visible');
						}
					}
				}
				var origObjectName=objectName;
				// hide the fields using style.display='none'
				if ('#(hideDependent)#' == 'hide') {
					if (objectName.substring(0,4) != 'div_') { // not a dependent text block
						objectName = 'div_' + objectName;
					}
					if (document.getElementById(objectName) != null) {
						if (value == true) {
							getStyleById(objectName).display='none';
						} else {
							// change display='block' to display=''
							// this accomodates dependent reg prompts placed on the same line - these are in a TR with the display attribute set at that level
							// TR with display='block' renders incorrectly in Chrome + FF
							getStyleById(objectName).display='';
						}
						/* remove spacing on hidden dep prompts + text blocks by specifying display: none on parent TR */
						var found = false;
						var pElem = document.getElementById(objectName);
						while ((!found) && (typeof pElem == "object")) {
							try {
								pElem = pElem.parentNode;
								if (pElem.nodeName.toLowerCase()=="tr") {
									found = true;
									if (!(hasClass(pElem,'ef_proweb_form_multiple_prompts_container'))){
										// restructured prompts on same line so don't hide the TR if > 1 child div
										if (value == true) {
											if (!(hasClass(pElem,"hiddenDep"))) {
												addClass (pElem,"hiddenDep");
											}
										} else {
											if (hasClass(pElem,"hiddenDep")) {
												removeClass (pElem,"hiddenDep");
											}
										}
									}
								}										
							} catch (ex) {
								found = true; // not actually found but avoid infinite loop in case of error
							}
						}
					}
					
				}
				if ($('#'+origObjectName).hasClass('ef_element_dropdown_searchable')) {
					ef.frontend.create_searchable_dropdown('#'+origObjectName);
				}
				
			}
		</script>
		<script language="cache" runat="server">
			set show=0
			if ((hideDependent="grey")!($G(%session.Data("inSitePageEditing")))) {
				set show=1
			}		
		</script>
		<csp:if condition=(show)>
			<script language="javascript">

				function supressDisabled(element) {
					var exe = '';
					var ok2 = '';
					if (element.substring(0,3) == 'rad') {
						var exe = "if (document.prowebCODForm." + element + "[0].disabled == true)  {	ok2 = true; }";
					} else {
						var exe = "if (document.prowebCODForm." + element + ".disabled == true)  {	ok2 = true; }";
					} 
					eval(exe);
					return ok2
					
				}
			</script>
		<csp:else>
			<script language="javascript">
				function supressDisabled(element) {
					var ok2 = '';
					if (document.getElementById('div_' + element) != null) { 
						if ( getStyleById('div_' + element).display == 'none') { ok2 = true} ;
					}
					return ok2;

				}
			</script>
		</csp:if>
		<script language='javascript'>
		function getStyleById(id) {
			// strip out the sub number in case wh dependent child is a multi checkbox series, they only have only div tag, not many
			return document.getElementById(id).style;
		}
		
		// function for disabling when clicking on  COD questions dependency
		function updateChildrenCheckboxes(objectName,value,checked) {
			var valuePairs=depends.split('|');
			var tmp=objectName.split("_");
			var surveyQuestionID = tmp[1];
			var parentElement = '';
			var child = '';
			var parentAltNo = '';
			var tmp2 = '';
			var antiValue = ''  // disable is true when value is false
			for (var i=0 ; i<valuePairs.length ; i++ ) {
				tmp=valuePairs[i];
				tmp2=tmp.split('->');
				
				childElement=tmp2[0];
				parentElement=tmp2[1];
				parentAltID=tmp2[2];			
				
				if ((parentElement == objectName) && (parentAltID ==value )) {
					antiValue = true;
					if (checked == true) {antiValue = false};
					toggleObjectDisable(childElement,antiValue);
				}
			}
		}	
		
		function updateChildrenRecursive(objName, bln){
			// need to check for any children of children (and etc) who also need to be disabled or enabled
			var valuePairs=depends.split('|');
			outerloop:
			for (var i=0 ; i<valuePairs.length ; i++ ) {
				if (valuePairs[i].length) {
					tmpArray=valuePairs[i].split('->');
				
					childElement=tmpArray[0];
					parentElement=tmpArray[1];
					val=tmpArray[2];
					if (parentElement == objName) {
						if (bln) { // disabling, no need to check val
						
							toggleObjectDisable(childElement, true);
							// break outerloop;
							updateChildrenRecursive(childElement, true);
						} else {
							// find value if radio
							if (parentElement.substring(0,3) == "rad") {
								questionValue = '';
								//PBUG3587: SHAHADAT : 28/06/2011 : Check if the item was passed as a hidden value (for readonly stuff).
								var str='';
								str = 'questionValue = document.prowebCODForm.' + parentElement + '.value;'
								eval(str);
								str = 'if ((questionValue=="")||(typeof questionValue=="undefined")) { for (ij = 0; ij<document.prowebCODForm.' + parentElement +'.length; ij++) { if (document.prowebCODForm.' + parentElement + '[ij].checked == true) { questionValue = document.prowebCODForm.' + parentElement + '[ij].value}}}'	
							} else {
								var str = 'questionValue = document.prowebCODForm.' + parentElement + '.value;'
							}
							eval(str);
							if (questionValue == val ) {
								toggleObjectDisable(childElement,false); //open child question
								// break outerloop;
								updateChildrenRecursive(childElement,false);
							} 
						}
					}
				}
			}
		}
		
		function updateChildrenDropdowns(objectName,value) { // also does radiobuttons
			var valuePairs=depends.split('|');
			var tmp=objectName.split("_");
			var surveyQuestionID = tmp[1];
			var parentElement = '';
			var child = '';
			var parentAltNo = '';
			var tmp2 = '';
			for (var i=0 ; i<valuePairs.length ; i++ ) {
				tmp=valuePairs[i];
				tmp2=tmp.split('->');
				
				childElement=tmp2[0];
				parentElement=tmp2[1];
				parentAltID=tmp2[2];			
				if ((parentElement == objectName) || (objectName == 'all'))  {
						
					if (parentAltID == value) {
						toggleObjectDisable(childElement,false); //open child question
						updateChildrenRecursive(childElement, false); //and children of children (and their children...)
					} else {
						toggleObjectDisable(childElement,true); //disable child question
						updateChildrenRecursive(childElement, true); //and children of children (and their children...)
					}
				}
			}
		}
		
		// update all dependencies on inital page load
		var valuePairs=depends.split('|');
		var parentElement = '';
		var child = '';
		var parentAltNo = '';
		var tmp2 = '';
		for (var i=0 ; i<valuePairs.length ; i++ ) {
			tmp=valuePairs[i];
			tmp2=tmp.split('->');
			childElement=tmp2[0];
			parentElement=tmp2[1];
			parentAltID=tmp2[2];			
			if (typeof parentElement != 'undefined' ) {	
				var myTempElement = document.getElementsByName(parentElement);
				if ($(myTempElement).length) { 
					// find value if radio. 
					if (parentElement.substring(0,3) == "rad") {
						value = '';
						var str='';
						str = 'value = document.prowebCODForm.' + parentElement + '.value;'
						eval(str);
						str = 'if ((value=="")||(typeof value=="undefined")) { for (ij = 0; ij<document.prowebCODForm.' + parentElement +'.length; ij++) { if (document.prowebCODForm.' + parentElement + '[ij].checked == true) { value = document.prowebCODForm.' + parentElement + '[ij].value}}}'	
					} else {
						var str = 'value = document.prowebCODForm.' + parentElement + '.value;'
					}
					eval(str);
					if (parentAltID ==value ) {
						toggleObjectDisable(childElement,false); //open child question
					} else {
						toggleObjectDisable(childElement,true); //disable child question
					}
				}
			} 
		}
			
		</SCRIPT> 		
	</csp:if>
	<script language="cache" runat="server">
		w !,"<scri"_"pt type=""text/java"_"script"">",!
		// pjc 2011-02-02 add JS alert to all reg pages if user navigates away from EF without submitting form
		new page, pages
		set needsWarning = 0
		if ($G(isCOD)!($G(isAward))!($G(isHotel))!($G(isForm))){
			set needsWarning = 1	
		}
		if (needsWarning = 0) {
			// array of pages that require a warning when navigating away
			set page=$ZCONVERT(%request.PageName,"L")
			set pages = $LISTBUILD("tChoosedays.csp", "tChooseItems.csp", "tVenueSummary.csp", "tHotelBooking.csp", "tBasket.csp", "tAccomGuest.csp", "tHotelList.csp", "taccomChooseDates.csp", "tpaymentMethod.csp", "tAwardsClient.csp", "tChooseSection.csp", "tAwardsEntry.csp", "tAwardsOverview.csp", "tAwardsSummary.csp", "tAwardsCategoryInterest.csp", "tAwardsCategories.csp", "tTableGuest.csp", "tAbsDocument.csp", "tAbsDocumentPreview.csp", "tAbsDocumentText.csp", "fileUpload.csp", "fileUploadFE.csp", "fileUploadAwards.csp")	
			for i=1:1:$ListLength(pages) {
				if ($ZCONVERT($List(pages, i),"L") = page) {
					set needsWarning = 1
					quit
				}
			}
		}
		if (%request.Get("mode")="edit"){
			// in edit mode so null the warning
			set needsWarning = 0
		}
		
		if ($G(%session.Data("inSitePageEditing"))){
			// in-site editing, so null the warning
			set needsWarning = 0
		}
		
		if (needsWarning = 1) {
			w "var warnOnExit=true;",!
			w "var warningMessage='"_..encodeJS(..out("Please confirm that you wish to leave this page and abandon any entered data"))_"';",!
			w "var formContentsDirty=false;",!
			// have we previously saved data from this registration session, other than what is entered on the register new page?
			set hasSavedData=0
			if ($G(tempPersonID) '= ""){	
				SET (codEmailID,codPwdID)=0
				&SQL(SELECT TOP 1 ID INTO :codEmailID FROM cod.objItemName WHERE LOWER(description) = LOWER('email'))
				&SQL(SELECT TOP 1 ID INTO :codPwdID FROM cod.objItemName WHERE LOWER(description) = LOWER('password'))
				&SQL(SELECT * FROM eCom.tempCodData WHERE tempPerson=:tempPersonID AND (objItemName != :codEmailID AND objItemName != :codPwdID))
				if (+SQLCODE=0){
					set hasSavedData=1
				}
			}
			w "var hasSavedData="_hasSavedData_";",!
		}
		w "</scr"_"ipt>",!
	</script>
		<script language='javascript'>
		function addEventStr( obj, type, fn ) {
			// version of the above adapted to be able to pass around previous event handlers
			// moilla sees these as strings, eg, the value of the onclick attribute
			// IE sees these as anonymous functions

  			if (typeof obj.attachEvent !== "undefined") { // IE
	  			var rndNo = Math.floor(Math.random()*11111);
    			obj['e'+type+rndNo] = function () { nullExitWarning(); if (typeof fn == "function") { fn(); } else { eval (fn); } };
    			obj[type+rndNo] = function(){obj['e'+type+rndNo]( window.event ); };
    			obj.attachEvent( 'on'+type, obj[type+rndNo] );
  			} else { // Mozilla
    			if (typeof obj.addEventListener === "function") obj.addEventListener( type, function () { nullExitWarning();  eval(fn); }, false );
  			}
		}
		
		function triggerExitAlert (evt) {
			if (typeof warnOnExit == "undefined" || warnOnExit !== true) { // should we be doing anything, ie, is an exit warning applicable?
				return;	
			}
			tmpWarningMessage = warningMessage;
			if (typeof formContentsDirty != "undefined" && formContentsDirty == false) { // exit warning applicable but have the form contents changed, check global var
				if (typeof hasSavedData != "undefined" && hasSavedData == false) { // form contents not changed, but has data been entered on other pages, check global var
					return;	
				} else if (typeof hasSavedData != "undefined" && hasSavedData == true) { // form contents not changed, but data has been entered on other pages so tailor warning message
					tmpWarningMessage="Please confirm that you wish to leave this page and abandon any previously entered data"; 
				}
			}
			warnOnExit = true; // reset global variable for next click in case they hit cancel
			evt = evt || window.event;
			evt.returnValue = tmpWarningMessage;
			return tmpWarningMessage;
		}
		
		function addOnClickEvts () {
			// pjc 2011-02-02 add onclick event to back/proceed buttons to toggle global variable
			// prevent spurious warnings about data loss when submitting the form
			// buttons can be links or inputs - use combination of tag name + class to target the elements
			// return true;
			var myElems = new Array();
			myElems.push (new Array('a','hyperlinkButton'));
			myElems.push (new Array('a','noWarn'));
			myElems.push (new Array('input','standardButton'));
			myElems.push (new Array('input','noWarn'));
			for(var i=0;i<myElems.length;i++) {
				elems = myGetElementsByClassName(myElems[i][1], null, myElems[i][0]);

				for (var x in elems) {
					// is this a back link? do nothing if so
					var elemText = '';
					if (elems[x].firstChild) { // is a link with a text node (firstChild)
						elemText = elems[x].firstChild.data;
					}
					if (typeof elems[x].getAttribute !== "undefined" && elems[x].getAttribute("value")) { // is a button with a value attribute
						elemText = elems[x].getAttribute("value");
					}
					if (elemText) {
						elemText = elemText.toLowerCase();	
					}
					if (elemText && elemText == "back") { // it's a back link
						continue;	
					}
					var oldFunc = null;
					if (typeof elems[x].getAttribute !== "undefined" && elems[x].getAttribute("onclick")) {
						oldFunc = elems[x].getAttribute("onclick");
					} else if (typeof elems[x].getAttribute !== "undefined" && elems[x].getAttribute("onClick")) {
						oldFunc = elems[x].getAttribute("onClick");
					}
					if (typeof elems[x].setAttribute !== "undefined") {
						elems[x].setAttribute("onclick",'');
						elems[x].setAttribute("onClick",'');
					}
					addEventStr (elems[x], 'click', oldFunc );
				}
			}
		}
		
		function addOnSubmitEvts () {
			// pjc 2011-04-19 prevent the warning firing on form submission
			var frmLength = document.forms.length;
			for(var i =0; i < frmLength; i++) {
				if (document.forms[i].attachEvent ) { // IE
	  				document.forms[i].attachEvent ('onsubmit', function () { nullExitWarning(); } );
	  			} else { // Mozilla
    				document.forms[i].addEventListener( 'submit', function () { nullExitWarning(); }, false );
  				}
			}
		}
		
		function addOnChangeEvts () {
			// pjc 2011-05-07 toggle a global variable when form contents are changed
			var frmLength = document.forms.length;
			for(var i =0; i < frmLength; i++) {
				var elemLength = document.forms[i].elements.length;
				for(var x = 0; x < elemLength; x++) {
					if (document.forms[i].elements[x].attachEvent) { // IE
	  					document.forms[i].elements[x].attachEvent ('onchange', function () { formContentsDirty = true; } );
	  				} else { // Mozilla
    					document.forms[i].elements[x].addEventListener('change', function () { formContentsDirty = true; }, false );
  					}
				}
			}
		}
		
		function nullExitWarning () {
			var oldWarnOnExit = false;
			if (typeof warnOnExit != "undefined") {
				//status of flag before nulling it - not necessarily defined
				oldWarnOnExit = warnOnExit;
			}
			warnOnExit = false;
			if (oldWarnOnExit) { // reset it if applicable
				var t = window.setTimeout("warnOnExit = true",1000);
			}
		}
		
		var addEvts = true;
		// @TODO do not rely on userAgent strings for browser identification
		var uaStr = navigator.userAgent;
		if (uaStr.indexOf('Safari') != -1) { // safari has a system confirm dialog if data has been entered
			if (uaStr.indexOf('Chrome') == -1) { // Chrome user agent string includes "Safari"
				addEvts = false;
			}
		}
		if (addEvts){
			addEvent (window, 'beforeunload', triggerExitAlert);
			addEvent (window, 'load', addOnClickEvts);
			addEvent (window, 'load', addOnSubmitEvts);
			addEvent (window, 'load', addOnChangeEvts);
		}
	</script>
</csp:if>

<script type="text/javascript">
	function highlightNonCODFields () {
		// function to add the error css class to mandatory non-COD items (which are dealt with in validateMandatory)
		if (typeof errFields != "string"){ // errFields is a tilde-separated string set server-side
			return;
		}
		arrErrFields = errFields.split('~');
		var maxErrFields = arrErrFields.length;
		for (var i=0, maxErrFields = arrErrFields.length;i<maxErrFields;i++) { // loop through all blank mandatory fields
			if (!(arrErrFields[i].length)) continue;
			for (var maxForms = document.forms.length, ii = 0;ii<maxForms;ii++) { // loop through all forms
				for (var maxElems = document.forms[ii].elements.length, iii = 0;iii<maxElems;iii++) { // loop through all form elements
					var myElem = document.forms[ii].elements[iii];
					if (myElem.name == arrErrFields[i]) {
						if ((myElem.type != "radio") && (myElem.type != "checkbox")) {
							addClass(myElem,"mandatoryIgnored");
						}
					}
				}
			}
		}
	}
	addEvent (window, 'load', highlightNonCODFields);
</script>
<script language="cache" runat="server">
	// any mandatory non-COD items flagged server-side that we need to highlight?
	if ($G(%session.Data("eventsforce","frontend","errFields"))'=""){
		write !,"<sc"_"ript language='javas"_"cript'>"
		set errString=%session.Data("eventsforce","frontend","errFields")
		write !,"errFields="_..QuoteJS(errString)_";"
		write !,"</sc"_"ript>"
		kill %session.Data("eventsforce","frontend","errFields")
	}
</script>

Property.name: creator
Property.Description: Who created this version of the data item.

Property.name: dataType
Property.Description: Used for identifying the class of the object withour having to call cache mysterious APIs.

Property.name: displayOrder
Property.Description: A display order number has to be set at creation time. It can then be swapped for the displayorder number of adjacent data item. This controls the order which the data is displayed in the backend data tree.

Property.name: nextVersion
Property.Description: Pointer to the next version of this data item. Not mandatory.

Property.name: parent
Property.Description: Points to the parent of this data item. This makes up the hiarachy. It has to be read by a recursive method to build up the tree structure.

Property.name: previousVersion
Property.Description: Poiter to the previous version of this data item. Note that this can be chain of many versions linked together.

Property.name: publishAt
Property.Description: If the object is to be published at a future point of time, use this prop.

Property.name: sourceID
Property.Description: if the object is a re-use of another object, indicate the ID of the orginal object here

Property.name: beforeItem
Property.Description: to override the template value - blank = nothing

Method.Description: Moves an object upwards or downwards in the displayOrder. Pass in "up" or "down". Method.name: clearDownBackendVariables
Method.Description: this is clearing all "backend" except the items listed here
Method.Implementation:
set keep("NAMESPACE")=1 set keep("xClientDir")=1 set keep("xClientStyleDir")=1 set keep("xPersonID")=1 set keep("xUserID")=1
set keep("xLangID")=1 set keep("xLanguage")=1 set keep("xWorkLangID")=1 // need this for page switching to remember current language
set keep("xDateFormat")=1 set keep("xTimeFormat")=1
set keep("xEventID")=1
set keep("orgunit event caching")=1
// Settings that only affect your current session set keep("proweb emergency repair mode")=1 set keep("override test colours")=1 set keep("showLegacyMode")=1
set keep("GlobalSystemSettings")=1
set var="" for { set var=$O(%session.Data("eventsforce","backend",var)) if var="" quit
if '$D(keep(var)) kill %session.Data("eventsforce","backend",var) }

Method.name: isEditMode
Method.Description: This method checks if the 'Edit' or 'Preview' flags are set for a proweb page. If so, it returns 1. Browser dependent %request and %session objects are used here. So, it cannot be used anywhere other than CSP pages.
Method.Implementation: set editMode = 0 if %request.Get("hideButtons") set editMode=1 if %session.Get("mode")="edit",'$G(%session.Data("inSitePageEditing")) set editMode=1 quit editMode

Method.name: getEditMode
Method.Description: This returns the mode of the page E.g. Edit, Preview Checks the request and the session so that it can be used in the page before the mode is set in the session Browser dependent %request and %session objects are used here. So, it cannot be used anywhere other than CSP pages.

Method.name: endSession
Method.Description:
Ends current session and clears down cookies
Should still have %session available in page
Must be called from preHTTP
Method.Implementation: Set %session.EndSession=1 Set Expires=+$H-1 Set Expires=$ZD(Expires,11) _ ", " _ $ZD(Expires,2) _ " 00:00:00 GMT" do %response.SetCookie("CSPSESSIONID-SP-8443-UP-","",Expires,"/",,1,1)
